title: Juan Ramón Paredes
text:
Juan Ramón Paredes Zelaya (born 23 May 1950) is a former <a href="El%20Salvador">Salvadoran</a> professional <a href="football%20%28soccer%29">football</a> player and currently manager.
Coaching career.
Alianza.
He became the coach of Alianza at the beginning of 2000 season, he went on to win the <a href="Primera%20Divisi%C3%B3n%20de%20F%C3%BAtbol%20Profesional%20Apertura%202001">Apertura 2001</a> in the process becoming the first and so far only Salvadoran to win a title with Alianza as coach. He took the team to several final series before quitting the club to become coach of the <a href="El%20Salvador%20national%20football%20team">El Salvador national team</a>.
Paredes led the El Salvador team to the <a href="Football%20at%20the%202002%20Central%20American%20and%20Caribbean%20Games">Central American and Caribbean titles in 2002</a>.
He quit as manager of <a href="Independiente%20Nacional%201906">Independiente Nacional 1906</a> in September 2006.
Once Municipal.
Juan Ramón Paredes was signed as coach of <a href="Once%20Municipal">Once Municipal</a> on 10 March 2008 after the shock resignation of <a href="Hugo%20Coria">Hugo Coria</a>. However Juan Ramón Paredes could not reverse the terrible form slump of <a href="Once%20Municipal">Once Municipal</a> after only 8 matches in charge with only 3 draws and 5 losses to show for it (including a 5-2 defeat by <a href="A.D.%20Isidro%20Metap%C3%A1n">Isidro Metapán</a>). Paredes resigned as coach on 27 April.
Other Coaching Duties.
In October 2009 he replaced Victor Girón at <a href="Fuerte%20Aguilares">Fuerte Aguilares</a> and in May 2010 Paredes signed up with fellow <a href="Segunda%20Divisi%C3%B3n%20de%20F%C3%BAtbol%20Salvadore%C3%B1o">Second division</a> side <a href="C.D.%20Municipal%20Lime%C3%B1o">Municipal Limeño</a> for the remainder of the 2010 Clausura season. In October 2010 he joined <a href="C.D.%20Atl%C3%A9tico%20Marte">Atlético Marte</a>, replacing <a href="Luis%20Guevara%20Mora">Luis Guevara Mora</a> who was moved upstairs to become Director of Sports.
Alianza.
Paredes has been given again coaching duties in <a href="Alianza%20F.C.">Alianza</a> after the team losing the clásico against <a href="C.D.%20%C3%81guila">Águila</a> at home. Paredes is replacing interim coach Cárcamo Batres.
